title: What were the main vehicles used to get disabled tanks out of combat in WWII? - Quora

response.answer_text: Typically, it would be another version of the same tank, issued at the company or battalion level. They usually had their turrets removed, and equipment like cranes, etc, for further salvage purposes. Divisional repair shops would also have their own vehicles for salvage purposes. You could also simply hook the damaged tank up to a number of your own vehicles, put the damaged tank in neutral, and tow it out. If you examine most military vehicles, you will find a great many of them come with tow hooks, front and rear.
Read this you will find a good fairly complete listing of tank recovery vehicles Armoured recovery vehicle .
I know the Germans had the Bergepanther and Bergetiger for these jobs although trucks with cranes were enough.
They would use things like half-tracks, normal tanks, or in some cases specially modified tank chassis used solely for recovering tanks, things such as the German Bergetiger.
